alert.note: Alert for Southeast Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 26 at 2:37PM AKST until January 28 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of up to 12 inches possible. * WHERE...Southeast Prince William Sound. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A series of storms will track from the Gulf of Alaska north into Southcentral. The first storm will pass well to the east of the area tonight. Thus, the threat for heavy snow has been pushed back to Saturday evening as the second storm arrives. This storm still has potential to bring a period of heavy snow, though there is a high level of uncertainty in the track of this storm. There is also potential for rain to mix in with the snow Sunday afternoon. Thus, snow accumulation could end up being much lighter than the amounts above. Additional storm systems and potential for more snow will follow through early next week.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
